headings: How The West Was Won!, Nov 21
ASU Trailblazer: Katie Jo Light, Nov 1
Agriculture Prof, Students & Alumni Shine at TSSRM Conference, Oct 31
paragraphs: Our world is driven by science, engineering and technology – and this college is your gateway to a wide variety of exciting and rewarding careers in those fields.
Through our academic programs, research opportunities, real-world experiences and unique facilities, you will be inspired to join the next generation of innovative scientists and engineers.
Geology professor creates a lasting legacy.

START at Angelo, allows incoming freshmen to participate in mathematics classes and campus-enhancing experiences. This free program is intended for students who have an interest in majoring in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) field, although it is not a requirement.

From the Hunter Strain Engineering Labs, Angelo State Natural History Collections and new ASU Greenhouse to our 6,000-acre MIR Center/ASU Ranch, our science and engineering facilities are second to none. These are just some of the facilities where you will gain valuable hands-on experience in your chosen field.
Live in Plaza Verde Residence Hall with other STEM majors and participate in activities, events, and research with faculty

In a student-centered environment, the College of Science and Engineering encourages and supports scholarship, inquiry, scientific literacy, and engagement in STEM through teaching, research, service, and community outreach.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

“I cannot express enough the value of ASU. You won’t walk out of here saddled with enormous debt, and that’s no small thing. ASU really offers an exceptional and accessible education.”

Dr. Michael Patyrak, Lead Team Radiologist, Dallas Cowboys, Class of 2002

“The engineering program serves to meet a real need in the West Texas community.”

Caleb Miller, Class of 2018, Civil Engineering

“The focus is on you as a student.”

Deyton Riddle, Class of 2018, Civil Engineering

“I’m super grateful for my time at ASU!”

Katie Jo Light, Biology, Class of 2016

“I only applied to one college, was accepted, and graduated ASU with a degree in applied physics. I’m proud to tell people that ASU now has a great engineering program.”

Travis Barnett, CEO, Centerline Engineering & Consulting, Class of 2012

“What truly sets the ASU Ag Department apart is the opportunities for internships and our ability to place students in successful careers when they graduate.”

Corey Owens, Class of 2005 and 2007

“The faculty have really prepared us. I feel prepared, not only to become a successful engineer, but to be ready for the workplace and to work on a team to come up with the best solution for our infrastructure.”

Deyton Riddle, Class of 2018, Civil Engineering

“I got offered a job the week I graduated. The faculty prepare you for what the job looks like. It’s not just getting an education. This is real – what you’re doing in school is how you’d design in the field. I know that mentality got me the job I have today.”

Ty Lee, Class of 2018, Civil Engineering

“My favorite class at ASU was Infrastructure and Economics of Engineering. We learned about our place in the world and how society, the economy, and the environment and resiliency interact.”

Robert Kody Womack, Class of 2022, Mechanical Engineering

“You’re not just a small fish in a big sea. You’ll know people on a personal level, and know your professors on a personal level.”

Katie Jo Light, Biology, Class of 2016

“The MIR Center/University Ranch is where the rubber meets the road for an Ag major. Here, you get to apply the knowledge learned in the classroom in a real-world setting.”

Corey Owens, Class of 2005 and 2007

“I found that my educational base allowed me to easily excel in my doctoral studies.”

Dr. J. Warren Brasher, Class of 1995, Biology

“The Angelo State Agriculture Department provided me with a multitude of opportunities to seek out potential careers and a great education.”

Corey Owens, Class of 2005 and 2007

“ASU did an excellent job of providing me the educational base needed to prepare me for my next degree.”

Dr. J. Warren Brasher, Class of 1995, Biology

“I am happy to receive an engineering degree from Angelo State.”

Ty Lee, Class of 2018, Civil Engineering
Develop and deliver an outstanding curriculum so that graduates of the College of Science and Engineering are well-prepared for both employment and graduate or professional education.
Deliver high-quality service courses to all students and programs at the university.
Promote and support inquiry and scholarship in STEM.
Through teaching, scholarship, service, and outreach, inspire engagement in and knowledge of STEM.
Acquire and maintain the equipment, supplies, and other resources necessary to support the teaching, scholarship, and service missions of the college.
